message.content:
A llama is a domesticated South American mammal that belongs to the camel family.
Llamas are medium-sized animals with a long neck and sturdy legs.
They have soft woolly fur that can range from white, beige, brown, or black.
Their fur is fluffy and the texture is very wool-like.
Llamas have long ears and a snout with two upper incisors and six lower incisors.
These animals are commonly used in trekking, packing, and as a source of wool.
You can find llamas in the Andes Mountains of South America, as well as in zoos and domestic farms all around the world.
